I have been comparing many conversions of this movie and can not speak for what will appear here, but most of them seem to have a kind of jitteryness in the movement noticable especially at 02min 25sec as space ship is passing close and the spinning part that is in the next few seconds although not in the smaller spinning part that is just frames behind it. . . Ending at 02min 325sec.   This is from frame by frame analysis so it is not just my player mind you.


I don't know much about such settings but the only one that I have found that does not seem to have this happening so far is from iwannadownload or so it says.

I just wonder if anyone else can confirm this for me or even possibly explain the differences that would lead to this during conversions.

I have always enjoyed SecretMyth for having high quality and in no way am trying to act as a referer to another site, it is just that this part of this movie is only not having this effect on their conversion.  I have seen it on three other similar sized versions today. But not the one from Iwan.'

Perhaps if this is noticed by anyone else in coparison to other versions.  They can say what seems to bee the difference in conversion settings.  As I assume that this where it is happening.

Thank you SecretMyth . . .you have been a source of great quality and I hope you dont see this as a criticism of your releases. And perhaps you can shed some light onto what I am observing as you seem to know much about conversions.

If you need me to provide the links to the exact downloads or try to cut clips from what I have obtained jusk ask.

Thank you again for your many High quality movies.     Dane . .

SecretMyth's being such a tease.  

I've no doubt he's having the same probs that plagued all of the dvdscr releases so far because of the poor source. The source screener DVD was split up into ~20 different PGCs (program chains) instead of one, separating the movie up into chunks like episodes on an episodic dvd. Trying to join them together to encode it all as one has apparently been causing considerable ivtc / frame dropping problems making playback jerky at parts. I've encoded a many a DVDRip myself but wouldn't know where to begin with that one. 

So far the ViSiON & FLAWL3SS releases have the least noticeable jerky playback probs probs (NOiR's wasn't too bad either) like the IMAGiNE, POCAHANTAS, & PrisM releases (and many other lesser known groups) all had. The ViSiON & FLAWL3SS releases do both still have one bad spot right before the 1hr mark that lasts about 10secs but otherwise they're both pretty good. A little dropped frames here and there but not to bad at all.

I've been waiting just like the rest of you all to see if SecretMyth's going to be able to do any better with it. Taking this long I suspect he's been busy trying just about everything, or else maybe he's run into some other problem.
